lines.text:
[Scrooge laughs while watching the Cratchits]
You laugh?

[at a huge Christmas Eve dinner being held for polite society]
My Lord, shall we proceed with your speech, or shall we let the ladies and gentlemen continue to enjoy themselves?
Look well, Ebenezer Scrooge, for only you can see me.
To Tiny Tim I'll be a second father.
I believe it has done me good and will do me good, and I say God bless it!
Merry Christmas and Happy New Year to all the world!

[speaking in the male voice heard on the soundtrack]
I am the Spirit of Christmas Past. I am here to show you the shadows of things that have happened. Look back beyond the gulf of vanished years...
My spirit never walked beyond the limits of our moneychanging hole. so I cannot rest; I cannot stay; I cannot linger - anywhere.
